TopicTitle: What did you do in KSP1 today?

Articles.Content:
OK so today i focused a lot more on building planes, I mean, I've gone to the moons of Jool but I haven't sent a single plane. Because I SUCK at building them.

First I tried to do a MK2 plane just to travel easily around the planet...

Ended up having a nice and fast boat...

But I managed to get that design right. Then I tried something bigger, tried to do a Shuttle with the knowledge learned before. I managed to make it barely fly, and I thought, now, let's attach it to the main rocket...

It didn't work. It was very unstable. And I said, F. those Kerbals...

Turning...

Ending the turn...

Aiming...

I barely hit it with my wings and flew above it...

And... I still suck at building planes, I think that I will never be able to make a Single Plane To the Sky.

 

Edited April 25, 2017 by Cristy2017

"Approaching Kerbin Space Station ... looking good... "

"Wait... where you said was that docking port?"

"We are equipped with the wrong one"

"Lets try this one"

"Does it fit?"

"Define fit"

"Can we dock?"

"No"

 

"We can't dock"

*Manual override*

"There comes a moment -"

*whoooshes into space*

Lessons learned today:

1. Shuttles suck

2. put on the correct docking port

3. Shuttles belong to a museum in KSC

4. Shuttles suck

Edited April 25, 2017 by hendrack

Today I have fulfilled this contract. There are a lot of pictures, so I hide them in the spoilers.

 

In addition, I had some inexperienced kerbals, so I have completed the mission with 5 kerbals. In the orbit was still the old mother ship from the flight to Otho and so I had to send only a new Lander. First the landing on Eta:

Spoiler

 

Then I wanted to refuel the mothership to return to Gael.

Spoiler

 

I noticed that the mothership has enough thrust to land on Eta too. So I docked the lander and landed with the whole thing.

Spoiler

 

After the refueling it went back home.

Spoiler

 

I became brave and tried to try the same on Ceti. It's worked out.

Spoiler

 

Then the same on Iota.

Spoiler

 

Finally, I then hit an orbit around Gael.

Spoiler

 

Now I just have to land the lander again on Gael to meet the contract. But parachutes are missing and so I have sent a small probe with Crewcabins and parachutes.

Spoiler

 

Then I dared to descend. It was a little hot, so I helped with the engines to reduce the speed.

Spoiler

Mechjeb dev build 694 make maneuver nodes work right in RO/RP-0 1.2.2!

So i tested it.  And recovered more kerbs from Skylag  err lab.

 

Edited April 25, 2017 by Bornholio

4 hours ago, V7 Aerospace said:

I like those wings a lot.

Thanks. They were actually based off of Hazard-ish's Laythe craft. Personally, I like them a lot too.

10 hours ago, qzgy said:

So technically, it doesn't really work like the ones used by the military, but it does produce the same effect.

Ah nice - I think I did it the military way - I embedded the LY-05 wheels in the cargo bay upside down, and had the pallet roll straight out the back.  Thanks for showing the detail

SM
I attached moar modules to my space station!

i blow up some rocket in the space after retrive all the spare parts from it; i just simply put a explosive charge ! ( i didnt know the explosive charge will be that powerfull)

Edited April 25, 2017 by jackstech

I'm testing my newest design of superheavy kerbin-mun ore carrier. Successfully reached mun orbit with enough fuel to make it to the surface, mine, relaunch and return, but failed during touchdown on mun surface since apparently the engine breaks during landing because of sheer mass of my contraptions. Well, time to go back to a drawing board

10 hours ago, cratercracker said:

Don't get political. Please.Please.Please.Please.

(i'm Russian,and this somehow offends me,but don't mind me,mind forum rules)

 

Now how can I take this seriously when you liked my post below it where my MiG 21 just shot down the tank....

Relax dude, Kerea is not a real country, this is just a game.

Btw, I love Russia.

Edited April 26, 2017 by Triop

A test mission of a next generation shuttle failed but I managed to save the pilot by landing it in the ocean like a Falcon 9 booster. A rescue plane is being dispatched as we speak

 

Edited April 27, 2017 by Fireheart318

Tried to make a replica of a HP.80 Victor (British V-Bomber).

Spoiler

Takeoff. Yeah, it doesn't have 6 engines. Through the magic of part clipping, it has.... 18 wheesleys, or about 6 goliaths.

Goes supersonic.

Back view.

Front view. I think it looks quite okay.

Bombing test.

Missed the target. If this wasn't KSP, it would probably have been a nuke, making dead precision unnecessary. But it got a nice trajectory.

Landing is .... an issue.

Bob deploys a small science beacon on Ceti before the whole gang heads back home.  This mission to Ceti hit 3 biomes and has been a bonanza! 

 

 

After the trip, we came home.  Splashdown at sunrise, boy thats pretty.

 

Edited April 26, 2017 by klesh
Added splashdown pic.

Brought a new mining base online today, putting – thanks to @Sassenach's firma mod – the first piece of brutalist architecture in space (where it belongs).

Edited April 26, 2017 by Odonian

Started playing with airships, ended up with amphibious seaplane which can land on belly.

 
Fairing is really OP, it has basically infinite impact tolerance. Structural failure is the only possible cause of explosions given that all parts are shaded in the fairing.
Edited April 26, 2017 by Reusables
album won't update :{

The Von Kerman Space Telescope was placed into a cismunar orbit...  but due to poor planning, it was not oriented correctly for solar cells to catch the sun's light, and it was dead in space.  (Some small solar cells placed on the side of the telescope to avoid just such an eventuality were, by chance, shaded by the scope itself...)

A rescue mission was mounted, and Eileen and Bill rendezvoused with the scope with the assistance of a Seba-D upper stage docking target and gave the scope a nudge... just enough to set it into a slow tumble so the emergency solar cells could be used to resuscitate the entire telescope.    Once the main solar cells were deployed, Eileen and Bill returned to Kerbin; a job well-done.

Good thing nothing like that ever happens IRL, huh?

11 hours ago, Abastro said:

Started playing with airships, ended up with amphibious seaplane which can land on belly.

 

Nice. I'm diggin' the blimp.

Finally got my first SSTM to Mun intact unfortunately, I didn't use closed cycle rapiers too much so I landed with around of 5,5t of useless oxidizer

I hope there's a return vehicle in that cargo bay!

 

-Jn-

Edited April 26, 2017 by JoeNapalm

7 minutes ago, JoeNapalm said:

I hope there's a return vehicle in that cargo bay!

-Jn-

Keep your hope  Luckily it was unamanned due to shortage of kerbals that aren't stuck in orbit like Bob here

Edited April 26, 2017 by Numerlor

6 minutes ago, Numerlor said:

Keep your hope  Luckily it was unamanned due to shortage of kerbals that aren't stuck in orbit like Bob here

 

Happens.

The black band on the Kerbol ribbon in my sig is for one of Anand Kerman's clones that was lost in deep orbit as the result of a freak TIE fighter replica christening accident. Was unable to recover him on several attempts (eventually lost that entire save to the Kraken).

I still sometime imagine him staring out the view port at the drone rescue vehicle that actually made it to him, but too low on fuel for a return attempt, and wonder what he must be thinking...

"They could have at least sent some snacks!"

 

-Jn-

Edited April 26, 2017 by JoeNapalm

Hello guys? How is goin' huh?                                                                                              i better stop introducing this way...

So here is some things i was doing lately:

1.Launch of the "Blue Dawn" mission. I was sick with my HyperEdited bases,so to i wanted to prove myself that i can do interesting things without using HyperEdit. So here is it ,in it's own minimalistic ,but fascinating way.

 

2. The "Emperor" mission. This is the largest 2.5m rocket i ever built. It was sent to Duna. Soon,it will descent to the surface and after that,the "Blue Dawn" modules will land nearby. (why would you land a lander near the base,if you can land a base near a lander. logicc). So yeah,laucnhing at early morning,that is my way.

 

 

 

3. Test of an old warhead "Oak".I wanted to turn war machines,into a explorers and scientists. I feal good whenever i do so. Its new usage is delivering small cargo in between peninsulas of Kerbin.

 

4.Laucn of the an other Mk-3 to the "Triangulurum". The crew had 3 missions-depart "Priroda' to the low orbit,depart "Ursa" resupply vehicle into its last voyage. And about Priroda module:it will be recovered by the first mk3 shuttle. Sorry didn't picture the launcher.

 

 

5.Tested a new plane-"Antipod-2". I like it is stable and has a quite low stall speed.

 

6. Photo of the day: "Emperor" over Duna's valleys.

I slap my face realy hard

Drink 5 bottles of water

Say "I will fail" 6 times

Just do something.

Alright,alright i will tell the secret-i have serious problems with sleep,so when i don't sleep i get myself a piece of paper and draw stuff i will be doing. As a sidequest i just look at concepts/projects of real mission and copy them.

What is this fail you speak of?  I only see experimentation and testing. Among the wonders of the space age are many wrecks and the blood sweat and tears of those involved.  I'm on my 38th attempt at return from Jupiter "Flying Low".

Say "I will learn" instead.  /smirk  The cat doesn't smile in satisfaction from eating it's fill.  It smiles having caught the mouse it stalked for three days.
